title: OgNasty
author: OgNasty
content: I just noticed the little birthday icon on my profile indicating that today is the day I signed up for Bitcointalk!¬† Pretty amazing really that it's been a dozen years now.¬† I guess that sort of makes me one of the old guys around here.¬† It's been a pretty crazy ride, but I'll admit it hasn't been all that surprising.¬† 12 years ago I signed up for this crazy forum to learn more about this new decentralized currency with a limit on the number of coins that can be produced.¬† I wanted to take part immediately and went from trading things for BTC, to mining, to helping others trade, then helping others mine who aren't able (through my community organization), and eventually creating cool products.¬† It's been an amazing ride with a lot of interesting speedbumps along the way, but still we roll on.¬† Some things I've done over the last 12 years that I think are cool...NastyFans - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=86854.0Escrow - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=303281.0Coins - https://nastyfans.org/mint

comments.author: God Of Thunder
comments.body: Congratulations OgNasty! It's not even 12 months since I am here. I did not have any conversation with you. Yet, I noticed some of your posts both in WO threads and other threads as well. Being in an online forum for twelve years is impressive. It seems there were a lot of ups and downs during your journey. A couple of red feedback proves the time was not good always. I understand a single person cannot be a good person for everyone. Or it's tough to maintain. Seems like you made some enemies. Still, you are in the forum and I believe people respect you. I hope you will be there for a long time. Good luck and Congratulations once again!

comments.author: Sexylizzy2813
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on June 04, 2023, 04:08:08 PMI just noticed the little birthday icon on my profile indicating that today is the day I signed up for Bitcointalk!¬† Pretty amazing really that it's been a dozen years now.¬† I guess that sort of makes me one of the old guys around here.¬† It's been a pretty crazy ride, but I'll admit it hasn't been all that surprising.¬† 12 years ago I signed up for this crazy forum to learn more about this new decentralized currency with a limit on the number of coins that can be produced.¬† I wanted to take part immediately and went from trading things for BTC, to mining, to helping others trade, then helping others mine who aren't able (through my community organization), and eventually creating cool products.¬† It's been an amazing ride with a lot of interesting speedbumps along the way, but still we roll on.¬† Some things I've done over the last 12 years that I think are cool...NastyFans - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=86854.0Escrow - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=303281.0Coins - https://nastyfans.org/mintWhat on earth I'm I doing? 12yrs? I'd like to be like you when I grow up.üòÖThat's a long period of time to be in this forum, congratulations to you @OgNasty, you took your time to follow every single rules and regulations in this (crazy Forum, like you called it) Forum and you're still here with us, it's a great thing to celebrate with you. I believe some other users have messed up their reputation but you stayed strong and believed that one day you'd be amongst the oldest users in this Forum. You can be old here but you're stronger when it comes to trading and giving advise to investors too.Congrats once again sir @OgNasty

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on June 04, 2023, 04:08:08 PMI just noticed the little birthday icon on my profile indicating that today is the day I signed up for Bitcointalk!Let me show everyone so they don't bother checking your profile.¬† Quote from: OgNasty on June 04, 2023, 04:08:08 PMPretty amazing really that it's been a dozen years now.¬† I guess that sort of makes me one of the old guys around here.¬† It's been a pretty crazy ride, but I'll admit it hasn't been all that surprising.¬† 12 years ago I signed up for this crazy forum to learn more about this new decentralized currency with a limit on the number of coins that can be produced.¬† I wanted to take part immediately and went from trading things for BTC, to mining, to helping others trade, then helping others mine who aren't able (through my community organization), and eventually creating cool products.¬† It's been an amazing ride with a lot of interesting speedbumps along the way, but still we roll on.¬† I'm not sure if I interacted with you much in one thread and ever learned some things from you - but it doesn't matter because I was impressed by your long history in the forums. Congrats to you and keep it up - and may you have the same passion for another 12 years. I hope you are well on your way to another long journey in the forum.

comments.author: demonica
comments.body: Congratulations! This is such a big achievement. Imagine 12 years of dedication contributing your knowledge, idea, opinion, and more to the forum that for sure helped others. This is a big motivation for me, and even for others who still have a long way to go to even reach a quarter of your time spent here in the forum. Seeing these kinds of posts or achievements from reputable members like you, helps me boost myself and gives me determination to be also a help to other members with what I can contribute here. Congrats once again @OgNasty! Cheers to more years with you here in bitcointalk.

comments.author: coinerer
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on June 04, 2023, 04:08:08 PMI just noticed the little birthday icon on my profile indicating that today is the day I signed up for Bitcointalk!¬† Pretty amazing really that it's been a dozen years now.¬† I guess that sort of makes me one of the old guys around here.¬† It's been a pretty crazy ride, but I'll admit it hasn't been all that surprising.¬† 12 years ago I signed up for this crazy forum to learn more about this new decentralized currency with a limit on the number of coins that can be produced.¬† I wanted to take part immediately and went from trading things for BTC, to mining, to helping others trade, then helping others mine who aren't able (through my community organization), and eventually creating cool products.¬† It's been an amazing ride with a lot of interesting speedbumps along the way, but still we roll on.¬† Congratulations for your 12th birthday and happy birthday to you. My profile was caked yesterday which means I didn't register on the Bitcointalk forum 3 june. It is displayed depending on the age set in our profile. It's admirable that you have been in this forum for 12 years. Best wishes to you and happy birthday again.

comments.author: rahulzx
comments.body: Congratulations OgNasty! Such Fantastic day, keep contribute here

comments.author: leonair
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on June 04, 2023, 04:08:08 PM~snip~What a surprise today is my birthday. so you and I were born on the same date. It's very nice. happy birthday brother. You donated 10 bitcoins for this forum. so do some giveaways for your birthday today. so this occasion I will celebrate my birthday with you for free of cost ¬† Don't mind i just having some birthday fun. anyway Happy birthday. May your life be happy and may all black obstacles be removed from you, I wish this for you.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: Congratz! What made you interested in Bitcoin so early? I have heard of BTC also around that time but wasn't so serious about it.In 12 years, you've been around in many bull runs. Which bull run have you profitted the most where you sold it all and bought back? Its been a ride that you have made different gigs.

comments.author: Popkon6
comments.body: Spending time online for 12 years is very impressive. I've seen a few accounts that are so old it's very difficult to earn 12-year mileage plaques. Even though many storms have passed over you, you have remained in good standing on the forum. Of course your journey and reputation will live forever among us, you are one of the few users who are famous in this bitcointalk forum. And I pray that you go ahead and achieve other milestones that will bring more glory to your life.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on June 04, 2023, 04:08:08 PM12 years ago I signed up for this crazy forum to learn more about this new decentralized currency with a limit on the number of coins that can be produced.And the rest is history brother! It's awesome to see after all these ups and downs you are still standing strong. Congratulations, and keep inspiring everyone. For me the best memory of you is how you kept your words and returned the 500 BTC that you were holding back in the days. Not many people will have such balls to keep such words. Happy birthday (Bitcointalk DOB LOL)

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: OgNasty is one of the guys I looked up here and I have a good reason why, he is one of the real achievers here in Bitcointalk, just having a donator on his profile speak about his status here in Bitcointalk, congrats not only on your birthday but on what you've achieved here in Bitcointalk.https://bpip.org/Profile?p=OgNasty

comments.author: royalfestus
comments.body: I have a deep appreciation for history as it greatly influences my decision-making process. Over the past 12 years, you have witnessed remarkable advancements in the new platform and innovations, despite the significant risks involved. Fortunately, these risks have paid off handsomely. Trust is crucial in the world of escrow, and you have consistently demonstrated your reliability and competence. However, I must admit that I do miss the presence of escrow services in forums, particularly when dealing with coins that have not yet been listed on exchanges. This topic is often overlooked or not given enough attention, but it remains highly important in such situations.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Not only you are the second active member here you contribute a lot here in Bitcointalk you are not just a plain member here but you have achieved a status in this forum that is hard to beat.Congratulations on your 12th year, so another 12 years?

comments.author: avp2306
comments.body: The real OG congrats for reaching this far even though you got red trust still you are one of best member of this forum. To many controversy happen fights or feud to other forum members but still you are standing strong. Hope to see more good contribution and contents here since you are one of the best members to follow.Best of luck hope to see you exist for long years and will not follow other well known user like the cat depart here.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Congratulations Donator Ognasty!12 years is a big number. I am still struggling with my 2years while someone has counted 12 years already. So, when I'll be celebrating my 10yrs in this forum, you will be celebrating 20tj year. A wooping decade difference. If you wish to write a book about your journey in this forum, it will be an interesting one. The 2nd most trusted in the forum and yet has about 8 negative tags. Reading through your feedback made me understand that many drama must have happened in the past, especially from Vod(who left upto 5 different negative feedbacks) and the TMAN.It's cool as a memory. If I may ask, how long do you intend to remain in the forum?

comments.author: 2Pizza410000BTC
comments.body: Congratulations üëèüëèüëèüëèüëè great man Ognasty.You are the VIP donator for Bitcoin forum.We can't stop praising you in one or two lines because for the last 12 years you have worked tirelessly and always committed yourself to the forum, it is truly unimaginable. By first donating to the forum, your contribution to the development of the forum is undeniable. We will always remember you as an ideal idolman of the forum and hope that like you we can contribute to the development of the forum.

comments.author: julerz12
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on June 04, 2023, 04:08:08 PMI guess that sort of makes me one of the old guys around here. Congrats Grandpa¬†  That's 4380+ days of your life spent in this forum! Definitely one for the books!Now you only need 4,740+ days to reach your Silver jubilee.

comments.author: Bitcoin_people
comments.body: Congratulations @OgNasty, as well as happy birthday, you have been on this bitcointalk forum for 12 long years. You are one of the oldest users I have seen you contribute a lot to the forum. Your praise will never end, you are a legend of this forum, been associated with this forum for 12 years. Also you are a respected Donator in this forum. We all respect you for having a legend like you in this forum.¬† My love and congratulations to you and I pray to God for your long life.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: bit traffic on June 04, 2023, 07:22:26 PMCongratz! What made you interested in Bitcoin so early? There isn‚Äôt just a single reason really. I liked a lot of things about Bitcoin when I first discovered it. The free transactions (once upon a time), no clawbacks, a limited number of coins, being able to mine at home, and it being open source software. Plus it was being traded 24/7 and the community was friendly and supportive. It was clear to see it was going places. Thanks everyone for all the kind words. I see a few people mentioning my negative feedback. All I can really say about that is it is a bit disgraceful that so many default trust members include users like Vod in their trust networks who publicly tried to extort me. As with everything nowadays, corruption at the highest levels.
